intro: Phelipanche zosimii, commonly known as the desert tomentose morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is characterized by its hairy, creeping stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in the morning, hence its common name. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of North Africa and the Middle East. Phelipanche zosimii is adapted to survive in dry conditions, with a deep root system that helps it access groundwater.
